intro: Cerastium clawsonii, commonly known as the Sierra sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its mat-forming growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils, often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its leaves are usually linear and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are pink or white, appearing in early spring. Cerastium clawsonii is well adapted to harsh climates and plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
